nodes.name: Load Profiles
nodes.notes:
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  NODE 2: LOAD PROFILE DATA
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  Loads candidate profiles from database for
  multi-user support

  Purpose:
  - Retrieves ALL profiles from database
  - Loaded ONCE at workflow start
  - Enables multi-profile/multi-user processing
  - Each profile gets personalized job search

  Database table: candidate_profiles
  Expected schema:
  - profile_id: string (PRIMARY KEY) - Unique identifier
  - full_name: string - User's display name
  - email: string - Delivery address
  - resume_text: text - Complete resume for AI
    evaluation
  - target_criteria: text/JSON - Job search criteria
  - notes: text - Additional profile notes (optional)

  Query behavior:
  - NO FILTER applied (gets all profiles)
  - Each profile processed sequentially by
    Loop Over Items

  Multi-user architecture:
  1. This node loads ALL profiles at once
  2. Loop Over Items processes one at a time
  3. Each profile gets:
     - Personalized company list (filtered by
       profile_id)
     - AI evaluation using their resume_text
     - Email delivered to their email address
  4. Single workflow run serves multiple users

  Data flow:
  1. Load profile(s) â†’ Loop Over Items
  2. Loop Over Items splits into iterations
  3. Each iteration:
     - Load Companies filters by profile_id
     - Merge nodes attach profile context
     - Loop Companies receives profile+company data
     - Loop Jobs uses resume_text for AI evaluation
     - Send Email delivers to profile's email

  Output: Array of profile objects (1 or more)
  Example:
  {
    profile_id: "jane_doe_pm",
    full_name: "Jane Doe",
    email: "jdoe@example.com",
    resume_text: "Senior Product Manager...",
    target_criteria: "{\"titleSearch\": [...]}",
    notes: "Focus on AI roles"
  }

  To add a new user:
  1. Add row to candidate_profiles table
  2. Add companies to companies table with new
     profile_id
  3. Run workflow - new user automatically processed
  4. No workflow modifications needed

  Next node: Loop Over Items

nodes.name: Start
nodes.notes:
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  NODE 1: START (MANUAL TRIGGER)
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  Workflow Entry Point - Top-level orchestrator
  for entire RoleFinder system

  What it does:
  - Starts the complete job monitoring pipeline
  when you click 'Execute workflow'
  - This is the top-level workflow that
  orchestrates all sub-workflows
  - Replaces the old pattern where Loop
  Companies was the entry point

  -  Profile loaded here (once) and passed down
  - Enables future multi-profile support (change
  profile_id filter)

  How to use:
  - In n8n UI, click the 'Execute workflow' button
  - Or schedule this workflow to run
  automatically (cron: 0 6 * * *)
  - Profile data flows automatically to all
  child workflows

nodes.name: Loop Over Profiles
nodes.notes:
=â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  NODE: LOOP OVER ITEMS
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  Iterates through profiles one at a time for
  multi-user support

  Purpose:
  - Processes each profile sequentially
  - Enables future multi-user/multi-profile support

  How it works:
  - Receives profile data from Load Profile node
  - Splits into batches (batch size: 1 = one
    profile at a time)
  - Each iteration processes complete pipeline
    for one profile
  - Loop advances after email sent for current profile

  Two outputs (pins):
  1. DONE BRANCH (output 0, top pin):
     - Fires ONCE after ALL profiles complete
     - Currently goes nowhere (end of workflow)
     - Future: Could trigger admin notification

  2. LOOP BRANCH (output 1, bottom pin):
     - Fires ONCE PER PROFILE
     - Routes to three nodes simultaneously:
       â€¢ Load Companies (filter by profile_id)
       â€¢ Merge Profile+Companies (input 0)
       â€¢ Merge Profile+Done (input 1)
     - This is where the work happens

  Data flow per iteration:
  Loop branch provides current profile to three nodes:
  - Load Companies: Uses {{ $json.profile_id }}
    as filter
  - Merge Profile+Companies: Provides profile
    fields for context
  - Merge Profile+Done: Provides user email/name
    for delivery

  Architecture significance:
  - KEY ENABLER for multi-user support
  - Single workflow serves multiple users
  - Each user gets personalized:
    â€¢ Company list (via profile_id filter)
    â€¢ AI evaluation (via resume_text)
    â€¢ Email delivery (via email address)
  - No separate workflow instances needed
  - Add users by adding profile rows in database

  Next nodes (loop branch):
  - Load Companies (filter by current profile_id)
  - Merge Profile+Companies (input 0, profile context)
  - Merge Profile+Done (input 1, email delivery)

nodes.name: Load Companies
nodes.notes:
=â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  NODE: LOAD COMPANIES
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  Retrieves target companies filtered by profile

  Purpose:
  - Loads companies from database for current profile
  - Filters companies by profile_id (multi-user support)
  - Each profile can monitor different company sets
  - Enables personalized company tracking per user

  Database table: Companies test v4
  Expected schema:
  - profile_id: string (PRIMARY KEY) - "default"
  - company_id: string (PRIMARY KEY) - "anthropic"
  - company_name: string - "Anthropic"
  - domain: string - "anthropic.com"

  Note: Composite primary key (profile_id,company_id)
  allows same company to be monitored by multiple
  profiles with different configurations

  Query filter:
  - profile_id = {{ $json.profile_id }}
  - Gets profile_id from Load Profile node output
  - Only returns companies assigned to this profile
  - Example: profile "default" sees only their companies

  Multi-profile architecture:
  - Profile 1 monitors: {Anthropic, OpenAI, Google}
  - Profile 2 monitors: {Meta, Apple, Microsoft}
  - Each user gets personalized company list
  - Same workflow handles all profiles

  Data flow:
  1. Receives profile_id from Loop Over Items
  2. Queries database for matching companies
  3. Returns array of companies (e.g., 40 companies)
  4. Flows to Merge Profile+Companies (input 1)
  5. Merged data goes to Loop Companies sub-workflow

  Output: Array of company objects, one per row
  Example for 3 companies:
  [
    { profile_id: "default", company_id: "anthropic",
      company_name: "Anthropic",
      domain: "anthropic.com" },
    { profile_id: "default", company_id: "openai",
      company_name: "OpenAI",
      domain: "openai.com" },
    ...
  ]

  Next node: Merge Profile+Companies (input 1)

nodes.name: Merge Profile+Companies
nodes.notes:
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  NODE: MERGE PROFILE+COMPANIES
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  Combines profile and companies into single array
  for sub-workflow

  Purpose:
  - Concatenates profile with company array
  - Creates ordered array for Loop Companies to parse
  - Profile comes first (item 0), companies follow
  - Sub-workflow extracts and merges fields internally

  Merge strategy:
  - Input 0: Profile data from Loop Over Items
    (single item with profile fields)
  - Input 1: Companies from Load Companies
    (array of company objects with profile_id)
  - Output: Concatenated array [profile, ...companies]
  - Uses n8n's default merge mode (append items)

  Why concatenate here?
  1. SINGLE ARRAY: Sub-workflow receives all data
     in one input
  2. ORDERED: Profile always at index 0, companies
     after
  3. CLEAN HANDOFF: Sub-workflow handles field
     merging internally
  4. SIMPLE: No complex merge logic in parent workflow

  Example input/output:
  Input 0 (profile):
  { profile_id: "default", full_name: "Jane Doe",
    email: "jdoe@example.com",
    resume_text: "...", target_criteria: "{...}" }

  Input 1 (companies):
  [
    { profile_id: "default", company_id: "anthropic",
      company_name: "Anthropic",
      domain: "anthropic.com" },
    { profile_id: "default", company_id: "openai",
      company_name: "OpenAI", domain: "openai.com" }
  ]

  Output (concatenated array):
  [
    // Item 0: Profile
    { profile_id: "default", full_name: "Jane Doe",
      email: "jdoe@example.com",
      resume_text: "...", target_criteria: "{...}" },

    // Item 1: Company 1
    { profile_id: "default", company_id: "anthropic",
      company_name: "Anthropic",
      domain: "anthropic.com" },

    // Item 2: Company 2
    { profile_id: "default", company_id: "openai",
      company_name: "OpenAI", domain: "openai.com" }
  ]

  Data flow:
  - Receives profile from Loop Over Items (input 0)
  - Receives companies from Load Companies (input 1)
  - Concatenates using n8n default merge (appends items)
  - Passes array to Loop Companies sub-workflow
  - Loop Companies "Merge Data" node extracts:
    - allItems[0] = profile
    - allItems.slice(1) = companies
    - Then merges profile fields into each company

  Next node: Call 'Loop Companies v4.1'

nodes.name: Call 'Loop_Companies_v4-2'
nodes.notes:
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  NODE 3: CALL LOOP COMPANIES SUB-WORKFLOW  â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  Executes the company discovery and job
  processing workflow

  Purpose:
  - Orchestrates company-by-company job discovery
  - Passes profile data from parent to child workflow
  - Handles all company iteration and error
  management
  - Returns control when all companies complete

  Workflow called: Loop Companies v3.1
  Input: Profile data from Load Profile node
  - n8n automatically passes data from previous node
  - Profile available as $json in child workflow

  What Loop Companies v3.1 does:
  1. Loads companies from companies table
  2. Iterates one company at a time (fault tolerance)
  3. For each company:
     - Calls Apify API to discover jobs
     - Enriches jobs with profile data
  (_context_profile_data)
     - Saves raw jobs to database (backup)
     - Calls Loop Jobs sub-workflow with enriched jobs
  4. Logs errors for failed companies
  5. Returns summary when all complete

  Execution time:
  - ~40 companies Ã— ~10 seconds per company = ~7-8 minutes total
  - Includes: API calls, database saves,
  sub-workflow calls
  - May vary based on job counts and API
  response times

  Waiting behavior:
  - This node WAITS for Loop Companies to
  complete entirely
  - All companies processed before advancing
  - All jobs evaluated by AI before advancing
  - This ensures complete data set for email
  generation

  Error handling:
  - Loop Companies handles errors internally
  - Failed companies logged to errors table
  - Workflow continues even if some companies fail
  - Main workflow always completes (no crash)

  Return value:
  Loop Companies returns:
  {
    workflow_run_id: 67890,
    companies_processed: 40,
    jobs_found: 120,
    errors: 5,
    execution_time_ms: 456000
  }

  This return data flows to Send Email for reference.

nodes.name: Merge Profile+Done
nodes.notes:
=â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  NODE: MERGE PROFILE+DONE
â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  Concatenates profile and completion data into
  2-item array for email workflow

  Purpose:
  - Combines profile with Loop Companies completion
    signal
  - Ensures Send Email workflow has profile context
  - Provides user information (name, email) for
    delivery
  - Links workflow execution to specific user

  Merge strategy:
  - Input 1: Profile data from Loop Over Items
    (user email/name)
  - Input 0: Completion data from Loop Companies
    (workflow_run_id, stats)
  - Output: 2-item array [completion, profile]
  - Uses n8n's default merge mode (append items)

  Why concatenate here?
  1. RECIPIENT INFO: Send Email needs profile.email
     for delivery
  2. PERSONALIZATION: Email includes profile.
     full_name
  3. TRACKING: Links workflow_run_id to specific
     user
  4. ORDERED ARRAY: Predictable structure for
     sub-workflow

  Example output structure:
  [
    {
      // Item 0: Workflow summary
      workflow_run_id: 67890,
      companies_processed: 40,
      jobs_found: 120
    },
    {
      // Item 1: User configuration
      profile_id: "default",
      full_name: "Jane Doe",
      email: "jdoe@example.com",
      resume_text: "...",
      target_criteria: "{...}"
    }
  ]

  Critical for email delivery:
  Send Email node accesses:
  - Item [0]: workflow_run_id for email_queue query
  - Item [1]: full_name and email for delivery
  - Pattern: {{ $('Start').all()[1].json.email }}

  Data flow:
  - Receives profile from Loop Over Items (input 1)
  - Receives completion from Loop Companies (input 0)
  - Concatenates into 2-item array
  - Passes to Send Email sub-workflow
  - Send Email queries email_queue by
    workflow_run_id
  - Delivers to profile.email address

  Next node: Call 'Send Email v2.3'

nodes.name: Call 'Send_Email_v2-4'
nodes.notes:
=â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  NODE 4: CALL SEND EMAIL SUB-WORKFLOW â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
  Executes the email generation and delivery workflow

  Purpose:
  - Aggregates all evaluated jobs from
  email_queue table
  - Generates professional HTML digest email
  - Delivers via Gmail API
  - Completes the daily job monitoring cycle

  Workflow called: Send Email v2.1
  Input: Summary data from Loop Companies
  - Receives workflow_run_id for querying email_queue
  - Profile data NOT needed (already embedded in
  job cards)

  What Send Email v2.1 does:
  1. Queries email_queue for all jobs from this
  workflow run
  2. Sorts jobs by overall_score (best matches first)
  3. Groups by recommendation category
  (excellent/good/consider)
  4. Generates dynamic email subject line
  5. Builds HTML email with all formatted job cards
  6. Sends via Gmail API
  7. Returns delivery confirmation

  Data sources:
  Send Email queries email_queue table:
  - WHERE workflow_run_id = {{
  $json.workflow_run_id }}
  - Gets ALL jobs evaluated during this run
  - Jobs already contain:
    - Complete job details
    - AI evaluation scores
    - Formatted HTML cards
    - Profile matching results

  Email structure:
  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
  â”‚ ðŸŽ¯ Your Daily Job Digest          â”‚
  â”‚ Monday, December 29, 2025          â”‚
  â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
  â”‚ Summary: 15 Excellent, 45 Strong   â”‚
  â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
  â”‚ [Job Card 1 - Score 10/10]         â”‚
  â”‚ [Job Card 2 - Score 9/10]          â”‚
  â”‚ ...                                â”‚
  â”‚ [Job Card 120 - Score 3/10]        â”‚
  â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
  â”‚ Footer: Workflow Run ID #67890     â”‚
  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜

  Execution time:
  - Query: ~1 second (120 rows)
  - Email generation: ~1 second
  - Gmail API: ~1 second
  - Total: ~3 seconds

  Delivery:
  - Recipient: [configured in Send Email workflow]
  - Method: Gmail API (OAuth2 authenticated)
  - Appears in: Gmail Inbox + Sent folder
  - Deliverability: >99% (verified sender,
  proper authentication)

  Error handling:
  - Gmail API failures logged in Send Email execution
  - Retry logic: 3 attempts with exponential backoff
  - If all attempts fail: Email saved to
  database for manual retry
  - User notified via separate error
  notification (if configured)

  Return value:
  Send Email returns:
  {
    status: "success",
    email_sent: true,
    recipient: "[email address]",
    jobs_included: 120,
    message_id: "<abc123@mail.gmail.com>",
    delivered_at: "2025-12-29T06:08:15Z"
  }

  Workflow completion:
  After this node executes:
  - Main workflow completes
  - User receives daily digest email
  - Database contains:
    - jobs table: Raw job data
    - email_queue table: Formatted job cards
    - errors table: Any failed companies
  - Ready for tomorrow's scheduled run
